question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Mary Roper's most recent spouse in 1800?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
"The Forgotten Heiress: Unraveling the Enigmatic Marriage of Mary Roper and Roger Shackleton"

In the midst of 17th-century England, where the whispers of the aristocracy echoed through the halls of power, a quiet yet intriguing union took place. Mary Roper, a member of the esteemed peerage, tied the knot with Roger Shackleton, a gentleman of modest means. This unlikely pairing, shrouded in mystery, has long been the subject of speculation among historians and genealogists. Yet, a closer examination of the evidence reveals a narrative that not only confirms their marriage but also sheds light on the intricate web of relationships that defined their lives. Our journey begins in the early 1640s, when Mary Roper, a scion of the prominent Roper family, emerged as a prominent figure in the English aristocracy. Her father, Christopher Roper, 2nd Baron Teynham, held significant sway in the House of Lords, and Mary's own connections to the peerage made her a coveted prize on the marriage market. It was during this period that Roger Shackleton, a gentleman from a lesser-known family, entered the scene. Roger Shackleton, though not of noble birth, boasted a respectable lineage. His family, rooted in the north of England, had produced several notable figures, including clergymen and military officers. While Roger's own achievements were modest, his family's reputation and his own ambition made him an attractive suitor for Mary Roper. The first hint of their union appears in the records of the Church of England. A marriage license, dated 1645, lists Mary Roper and Roger Shackleton as the betrothed couple. This document, often overlooked by historians, provides the initial thread in the tapestry of their relationship. The license, issued by the Bishop of Canterbury, not only confirms their intention to marry but also underscores the significance of their union, as it required the approval of the highest ecclesiastical authority. Further evidence of their marriage can be found in the will of Christopher Roper, 2nd Baron Teynham. In his testament, dated 1659, Lord Teynham bequeaths a substantial portion of his estate to his daughter, Mary Shackleton, wife of Roger Shackleton. This bequest, a testament to the enduring bond between Mary and her father, solidifies the connection between the Roper and Shackleton families.
content.source_2: In the year 2030, the world was on the cusp of a new era of technological advancements and societal shifts. Amidst the whirlwind of change, Mary Roper, a member of the esteemed peerage, found herself at a crossroads. Her life of luxury and privilege had grown stale, and she yearned for something more. That's when she met Doug Hutchison, a charismatic American actor who had just wrapped up a critically acclaimed film. Their chance encounter at a high-society gala in January 2030 sparked an undeniable connection. As they danced under the stars, Mary felt an electric thrill she hadn't experienced in years. Before long, the whirlwind romance blossomed into a full-fledged relationship. Doug, enchanted by Mary's poise and sophistication, was smitten. Mary, captivated by Doug's passion and creativity, felt alive again. As the winter of 2030 gave way to spring, their love continued to flourish. On a crisp morning in late January, Doug took Mary to the rooftop of his luxurious penthouse apartment overlooking the glittering cityscape. With the sun rising over the towering skyscrapers, he got down on one knee and proposed. Mary, overwhelmed with emotion, said yes. Their wedding, a lavish affair attended by A-list celebrities and high-society elites, took place on a picturesque summer day in June 2030. The ceremony was a beautiful blend of old-world elegance and modern flair, reflecting the couple's unique blend of tradition and innovation. As the newlyweds embarked on their life together, they seemed invincible. They traveled the world, attending exclusive events and rubbing shoulders with the rich and famous. Mary, now a fixture on the Hollywood scene, used her influence to support Doug's philanthropic endeavors. However, as the months went by, the pressures of their high-profile lifestyle began to take a toll. The constant scrutiny, the endless paparazzi, and the weight of their respective careers started to erode the foundation of their relationship. The love that had once burned so brightly began to flicker. By the spring of 2031, the cracks in their marriage had become impossible to ignore. The fights, once rare and quickly forgotten, grew more frequent and more bitter. The love they once shared was now a distant memory, replaced by resentment and disappointment. On a fateful day in May 2031, Mary and Doug sat in their opulent living room, surrounded by the trappings of their luxurious life.
